results.title: JFK: Director's cut. Beyond JFK: the question of the conspiracy
results.creator_credit: A. Kitman Ho, Ixtlan Corporation and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: Starring Kevin Costner, Joe Pesci, Tommy Lee Jones, and Gary Oldman, JFK also features an extensive gallery of appearances by acclaimed actors including Ed Asner, Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon and Donald Sutherland. This exclusive release has an exta 17 minutes of new footage added, providing more excitement, intrigue and insight into Jim Garrison’s turbulent investigation of President John F. Kennedy’s assassination. Also included on this tape is “Beyond JFK: The question of the conspiracy” a ninety-minute documentary that re-examines the issues raised by the film, featuring interviews with the people who were involved in the Garrison investigation plus astonishing eyewitness accounts. Includes Jim Garrison’s last recorded interview before he died.

results.title: Jewels of the Kimberley
results.creator_credit: Mitch Matthews, Rio and Rhonda Mabey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
The original jewels in the Kimberley in Australia’s far north west were the hardy pioneer cattlemen and women who crossed the Continent with their herds to establish themselves as Kings in Grass Castles. They were followed by gold prospectors and farmers who opened up the mighty Ord River Irrigation Scheme. The newest jewels are diamonds. They were discovered by the new prospectors who are now reaping rich rewards for the millions of dollars they spent prospecting for their jewels. Rated: G

results.title: Jewellery through 7000 years (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Pieces from Ancient Egypt, China, Sumeria, Greece, Celtic Europe and Byzantium, and examples of the Gothic Renaissance, Elizabethan and Art Nouveau styles are shown. Old techniques for working gold are demonstrated. Also refers to the superstitious, mythological, cultural and religious influences on jewellery design and usage.
results.description: Pieces from Ancient Egypt, China, Sumeria, Greece, Celtic Europe and Byzantium, and examples of the Gothic Renaissance, Elizabethan and Art Nouveau styles are shown. results.title: Jewellery making: acrylics
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Terry Jennings
results.brief_description: Deals with the use of both solid and liquid acrylic in the production of modern jewellery. One of Australia’s leading jewellers. Rex Keogh, shows the way his own pieces use these simple processes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation and Terry Jennings
results.description: Deals with the use of both solid and liquid acrylic in the production of modern jewellery. One of Australia’s leading jewellers. Rex Keogh, shows the way his own pieces use these simple processes.

results.title: Jewellery making. Part 2: casting
results.brief_description: The second film in a series introducing the techniques of modern jewellery making. Demonstrates two popular methods of using cuttlefish bones and “lost wax” for preparing moulds to create solid jewellery shapes and sizes by two leading Australian jewellers, Rex Keogh and Norman Creighton.
results.description: The second film in a series introducing the techniques of modern jewellery making. results.title: Jewellery making. Part 1: metal working
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Terry Jennings
results.brief_description: The first in a series of three films on the techniques used in the creation of modern jewellery by professional craftsmen. Explains the techniques of sawing, drilling, soldering and finally filing and polishing various metals to make strikingly attractive jewellery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation and Terry Jennings
results.description: The first in a series of three films on the techniques used in the creation of modern jewellery by professional craftsmen. Explains the techniques of sawing, drilling, soldering and finally filing and polishing various metals to make strikingly attractive jewellery.

results.title: Jettison
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Adrian Rose
results.brief_description: Abstract shapes, distorted figures jettison on and off the screen metamorphosing to the rhythmic beat of “The Deadly art of knowledge” by Chris MacKellar. A vibrant celebration of the potential of animated forms to constantly move, change and surprise. Obtained an Honourable Mention in the Australian Panorama section of Australian International Animation Festival
results.creator_credit_for_label: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Adrian Rose

results.title: Jets and rockets: how they work
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of jet engine propulsion by establishing Newton’s principle of action and reaction, and the principle of imbalance of forces. Discusses the varius types of fuel requirements for rockets.
results.description: Explains the principles of jet engine propulsion by establishing Newton’s principle of action and reaction, and the principle of imbalance of forces. Discusses the varius types of fuel requirements for rockets.

results.title: Jetobatics
results.brief_description: We meet the four Royal New Zealand Air Force pilots who form New Zealand’s team of jet plane aerobats and travel in their Vampire jet aircraft while they give a magnificent display of high speed aerobatics and smoke pattern making in the sky.
